document.masterDocTitle: New taxa of the genus Phlugiolopsis (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae: Meconematinae) from Yunnan, China, with comments on the importance to taxonomy of the left tegmen

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New taxa of the genus Phlugiolopsis (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae: Meconematinae) from Yunnan, China, with comments on the importance to taxonomy of the left tegmen

heading.emphasis:
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) platylobosis Bian
& Shi, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Holotype , ♂ , Banhong , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China ,
7 August
, 2016, coll. Baojie Du & Qidi Zhu.
Paratypes : 1♂ , Banhong , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China ,
7 August
, 2016, coll. Baojie Du & Qidi Zhu
;
1♂ , 1♀ , Banhong , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China , coll. Baojie Du & Xinghui Zhu
;
1♂ , Banhong , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China ,
8 August
, 2016, coll Baojie Du & Qidi Zhu
;

;

9 August
, 2016, coll. Baojie Du & Xinghui Zhu
;
1♂ , Banlao , Cangyuan , Yunnan ,
10 August
, 2016, coll. Baojie Du & Qidi Zhu
;
1♂ , Banlao , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China ,
12 August
, 2016, coll. Baojie Du & Xinghui Zhu
;

specimens:
1♀ , Banhong , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China ,
26 July
, 2013, coll. Jiaguo Gao , Yuan Li & Xinghui Zhu
;
1♂ , Banhong , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China ,
30 July
, 2013, coll. Guanglin Xie
;
1♂ , Banhong , Cangyuan , Yunnan , China ,
7 August
, 2016, coll. Baojie Du & Qidi Zhu .

Description. Male. Yellowish brown. Head . Face light brown. Internal margin of antennal socket, scape and pedicel blackish brown. Fastigium verticis conical, apex obtusely rounded, in the centre with a shallow furrow; dorsal surface of head with 4 distinctly brown stripes: outer stripes narrower, which extending to internal margin of antennal socket and continued about two-thirds along the pronotum; medial stripes slightly broader, fused in fastigium verticis ( Figure 6A ). Eyes round-oval, brown. Apical segments of maxillary palpi longer than subapical ones, apices slightly inflated; the apices of maxillary palpi brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) platylobosis Bian
& Shi,
sp. nov.
male: A–B. pronotum: A. dorsal view, B. lateral view; C, F–H. apex of abdomen: C. dorsal view, F. lateral view, G. ventral view, G. apico-ventral view; D–E. right circus: D. dorsal view, E. ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Tegmina. Tegmina covered by the pronotum, the posterior margin reaching the middle area of second abdominal tergite; margins of the tegmina darker brown ( Figure 6B ). Hind wings absent.

Legs. All femora without ventral spines. Fore coxae with a small spine. Fore tibiae with 4 internal and 5 external spines on ventral margin, apices with 1 pair of ventral spines. Genicular lobes of hind femora with obtuse apices, black; tibiae with 25–28 internal and 29–34 external spines on ventral surface, ventral surface with 3–4 internal spines and 5–6 external spines, apices with 1 pair of dorsal spines and 2 pairs of ventral spines, darkish brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Phlugiolopsis
species: A–F.
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) latusiprocera
sp. nov.
; G–H.
Phlugiolopsis ( Longiloba ) montana
; A, C, G–H. male; B, D, E–F. female; A–D, G–H. adults; E. nymph; F. last nymph (late instar nymph).

FIGURE 8. Left tegmen of
Phlugiolopsis
species. A.
Phlugiolopsis digitusis
; B.
Phlugiolopsis ( Longiloba ) complanispinis
; C.
Phlugiolopsis ventralis
; D.
Phlugiolopsis xinanensis
; E.
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) latusiprocera
sp. nov.
; F.
Phlugiolopsis ( Longiloba ) montana
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements. Body length: ♂ 7.8–8.8 mm , ♀ 7.5–7.8 mm ; length of pronotum: ♂ 4.1–4.3 mm , ♀ 4.0– 4.4 mm ; length of hind tegmina: ♂ 2.5–2.6 mm , ♀ 2.3–2.5 mm ; length of hind femora: ♂ 9.2–9.5 mm , ♀ 9.6–10.1 mm ; length of ovipositor: 6.9–7.1 mm .

Remarks. The new species differs from
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) mistshenkoi (Gorochov, 1993)
and
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) angustimarginis Bian
& Shi,
sp. nov.
in: the basal area of male cerci with 1 wider keelshaped dorsal lobe; apical area of subgenital plate nearly rectangular projected in middle, which curved ventrad, centre of posterior margin slightly concave, whereas the dorsal lobe of male cerci in
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) angustimarginis Bian
& Shi,
sp. nov.
narrower and the posterior margin of male subgential plate in
Phlugiolopsis ( Uncinata ) mistshenkoi (Gorochov, 1993)
not projecting.

Etymology. The specific name ‘
platylobosis
’ is derived from Latin word ‘ platy ’ (=wide) and ‘ lob ’ (=lobe). It refers to the wider dorsal keel-shaped lobe of male cerci.
